Dialogue.NPCText:
A pale woman sits within a swirl of drifting silks, her eyes half-lidded as if peering through you—and something beyond. Wisps of dream-stuff curl about her fingers.

"The waking world is only half the truth, wanderer. Dreams ride the air above Aerilon, as real as wind or stone. I am Meliara, Dreamsinger of the Veil.
Do you seek solace, secrets... or the paths that flicker between?"

Option.text: I bring a dream-touched artifact for interpretation.
Who are you, Meliara?
What is the Dream Veil?
Eryndil sent me—he trusts your visions.
Tell me of your past, Meliara. Dreams do not grow from nothing.
I only wished to look upon the famed Dreamsinger.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She smiles faintly, the gesture both warm and distant.

"In the waking, I was once a student of Wind, a rival to those who built Aerilon’s engines. But in dream, I wandered deeper. Now I drift the Veil—gathering echoes, half-truths, and warnings.
Eryndil, the archivist, calls me friend; Selara Vael mistrusts what cannot be measured. But secrets come to me unbidden—sometimes even answers."

Option.text: Tell me of Eryndil.
What of Selara Vael?
I carry an artifact touched by dream.
What is the Dream Veil?
I will return when ready.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Eryndil walks between past and present as I walk between sleep and waking. He trusts my visions when his books grow silent.
He once confided his fear: that Aerilon’s fate is written in a language only dreamers can read. He is wise—but not always brave."

Option.text: I bring an artifact, as Eryndil suggested.
What do you see for Eryndil’s future?
What is the Dream Veil?
I must go for now.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Selara’s mind is a fortress—sharp, proud, unyielding. She fears what cannot be held or counted. Yet sometimes, I glimpse her in dream: walking a path of doubt, haunted by the shadow of her own ambition.
She does not despise me, though. Once, in secret, she asked for a vision of her future. I told her only this: 'Not all storms come from without.'"

Option.text: Your words are... enigmatic.
Back to matters at hand.
What is the Dream Veil?
Farewell, for now.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Dreams are riddles, not maps. Would you have me offer a lantern to every shadow? Some truths are best glimpsed only in the corner of one’s eye."

Option.text: I carry a dream-touched artifact.
What is the Dream Veil?
Enough riddles for now.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Her eyes brighten, distant but eager.

"The Dream Veil is a borderland, thin as breath, where waking thoughts and sleeping truths mingle. There, memories twist and futures whisper. To some, it is madness. To me, it is home.
Many in Aerilon scorn such mysteries. Yet even the crystals above us sometimes sing in their slumber. Listen long enough, and all things dream."

Option.text: I seek to understand a dream artifact.
I wish to know more about you.
Farewell, for now.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Eryndil’s path branches like a river in flood: wisdom, loneliness, perhaps betrayal. Yet always, he seeks the dreamer’s key. Help him, and Aerilon may yet wake to a dawn without regret."

Option.text: I carry an artifact for your insight.
Thank you for your vision.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She inclines her head serenely.

"Even a passing glance is a kind of dream. May the Veil brush gently upon your brow, wanderer."

Option.text: Wait—actually, I need your help.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Meliara’s fingers graze the artifact, her gaze unfocusing.

"Ah... the Veil shivers at your touch. This object is more than it seems—a vessel of hope, regret, and prophecy. Its dreams are tangled with shadow iron and the restless earth.
I sense it calls to one who has shaped or studied the spirits of metal and dusk... a scholar of the Shadow Iron Elementals, far from this city.
Would you bear it beyond Aerilon’s spires, and place it in the right hands?"

Option.text: I will deliver the artifact to the Shadow Iron Elemental Scholar.
Who are these scholars?
What danger lies in this errand?
Why must it leave Aerilon?
I need time to ponder.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She hands you a velvet pouch, faintly glowing, within which the artifact softly hums.

"Give this into the care of a Shadow Iron Elemental Scholar outside our walls. Only they may quiet its restless dreams. Beware: Minax’s followers hunger for any trace of prophecy, and Wind’s agents covet all that blurs waking and dream.
Return to me when the delivery is done. In dreams, all journeys end where they began."

Option.text: I will see it safely delivered.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"They are few—keepers of forbidden lore who commune with the spirit-matter of shadow iron. Some were once students of Wind, others miners or alchemists exiled from Minoc.
Seek one who bears the Scholar’s mark and knows the names of sleeping stones. They will understand the artifact’s need."

Option.text: I accept the task.
Tell me more about the artifact’s dreams.
I must consider this carefully.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Her lips curve in a secret smile.

"To bear a dream between waking worlds is always perilous. Envy, greed, and misunderstanding are as sharp as blades.
Should you be threatened, whisper the word ‘Oneiros’—the Veil may answer, if your heart is true."

Option.text: I accept this risk and the task.
Perhaps I am not suited for this dream.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Not all dreams may rest in the sky. This artifact is restless—tethered to the elementals deep below. If it lingers, its dreams will fester, seeping into Aerilon’s crystal hearts. Only by placing it in the right hands can the balance be kept."

Option.text: Then I will deliver it.
What dreams lie within the artifact?
I must decline for now.

Dialogue.NPCText: "It is filled with memories—not only of Lord British, but of all who have walked the line between fate and freedom. Within, a fragment of the King’s final vision lingers, echoing with hope... and warning. Give it to one who understands dreams, and you may yet change what is to come."

Option.text: I accept the task.
Thank you for sharing your wisdom.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Meliara’s expression shifts—softening, but not quite smiling. She lowers her gaze as if watching her own reflection drift across unseen water.

"A rare question. Most seek my foresight, not my footprints."
She gestures gently, and the air thickens with silvery motes.
"Then walk with me, if only in words. What would you know?"

Option.text: What was your life before the Dream Veil?
How did you gain the gift of dreamsight?
Have you loved, or been loved?
What do you dream of now?
That is enough of the past.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"In the stone halls of Wind, I was nothing special. A middling apprentice, bright enough, but too curious. I asked questions the masters refused to hear. So I listened instead to what they called silence—and it whispered back."

"One night, I walked into a ritual I was forbidden to witness. When I awoke, I was no longer theirs. Nor fully yours."

Option.text: That sounds dangerous. Were you banished?
What did you see in that ritual?
Your path is strange, but you walk it well.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Banished? No. Worse. They *forgot me.* My name erased from ledgers, my chambers claimed by others. In their eyes, I had never been."
She exhales slowly, her voice threaded with sorrow.
"Yet here I remain. Wind does not forget, not truly. One day, they will remember—and tremble."

Option.text: You deserve better than oblivion.
Perhaps they were wise to fear you.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"I saw a mirror of sky, broken across an ocean. I saw Lord British, lost within a dream not his own. I saw Minax... *not yet monstrous*, but mourning something she could not name."
Her eyes shimmer faintly.
"I have spent every moment since trying to understand what was true—and what was merely mine."

Option.text: Was Lord British truly dreaming?
What sorrow could Minax carry?
Such visions would break lesser minds.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Kindness... not often shown to seers. Thank you."
A soft warmth lingers in her aura, and a mote of dreamlight drifts to your shoulder.

Option.text: (You feel oddly invigorated.)

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Not a gift... a wound the world whispers through."
She gently touches her temple.
"The Veil bled into me when I crossed the threshold uninvited. Now I sleep little, and when I do, I walk among truths half-formed."
"Sometimes I envy those who close their eyes and see only black."

Option.text: Would you give up your sight if you could?
There is beauty in your burden.
You are a conduit—dangerous, and needed.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"No."
A fierce stillness enters her voice.
"I would not. Even when it hurts, I *know*. And that is worth all the sleepless nights."

Option.text: Then may your knowing shape the waking world.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"A rare sentiment. You have the soul of a poet."
She draws a sigil in the air—dreamlight curls behind it like perfume.

Option.text: (You feel creativity swell within you.)

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Dangerous... yes. To others. To myself. But necessary."
Her hand tightens around her sash.
"The dreams must be spoken, or they fester into prophecy denied."

Option.text: I will help carry that burden, if I can.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"A question from the heart."

"There was one—a crystal engineer. His dreams were of machines and stars, not prophecy. For a time, we shared both our silences and our shadows. But the Veil... it takes more than it gives."
"He could not follow. And I could not stay."

Option.text: Do you still see him in dreams?
You loved truly. That matters most.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She nods slowly.
"Sometimes. He is always building, reaching. Never looking back. That is how I know he lives."
"That is how I know I still do."

Option.text: That is beautiful... and painful.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Now? I dream of a sky that sings. Of a gate carved from light. Of a king lost in the weave of fate—and a hand that reaches, still."
She closes her eyes briefly.
"I do not yet know whose hand it is. Perhaps... it is yours."

Option.text: (You feel a strange warmth in your palm.)

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Yes. Or something wearing his shape. His dream spirals inward, deeper than the Veil should allow. It is not slumber. It is... *containment.*"
"If he wakes, the world will shift. If he sleeps, the shards may shatter again."

Option.text: Then we must find a way to reach him.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Even monsters mourn. I saw her standing over a grave without a name. Rage comes from loss as often as hatred. But her grief is poison now."
"She seeks the Gem not for power... but to undo a moment that cannot be undone."

Option.text: That makes her even more dangerous.
Then perhaps... she can still be reached.
